p.b: This code system defines the following properties for its concepts

tr.td: The child code is a more narrow version of the concept represented by the parent code. I.e. Every child concept is also a valid parent concept. Used to allow determination of subsumption. Must be transitive, irreflexive, antisymmetric.
Inverse of Specializes. Only included as a derived relationship.
The internal identifier for the concept in the HL7 Access database repository.
Designation of a concept's state. Normally is not populated unless the state is retired.

div.p: This case-sensitive code system http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v3-PaymentTerms defines the following codes in a Is-A heirarchy:

tr.td: Payment in full for products and/or services is required as soon as the service is performed or goods delivered.
Payment in full for products and/or services is required 30 days from the time the service is performed or goods delivered.
Payment in full for products and/or services is required 60 days from the time the service is performed or goods delivered.
Payment in full for products and/or services is required 90 days from the time the service is performed or goods delivered.

description.value:
Describes payment terms for a financial transaction, used in an invoice.
This is typically expressed as a responsibility of the acceptor or payor of an invoice.

description.value: The child code is a more narrow version of the concept represented by the parent code. I.e. Every child concept is also a valid parent concept. Used to allow determination of subsumption. Must be transitive, irreflexive, antisymmetric.
Inverse of Specializes. Only included as a derived relationship.
The internal identifier for the concept in the HL7 Access database repository.
Designation of a concept's state. Normally is not populated unless the state is retired.

definition.value: Payment in full for products and/or services is required as soon as the service is performed or goods delivered.
Payment in full for products and/or services is required 30 days from the time the service is performed or goods delivered.
Payment in full for products and/or services is required 60 days from the time the service is performed or goods delivered.
Payment in full for products and/or services is required 90 days from the time the service is performed or goods delivered.
